Luggage Guardian — An Intelligent Anti-Theft Monitoring System for Travelers

April 2020

Traditional suitcases rely mainly on passive measures such as combination locks and cannot provide comprehensive, smart protection. As a result, luggage and briefcases are frequently lost or stolen during trips, causing both financial loss and travel anxiety. To solve this problem, I led a team to develop “Luggage Guardian,” an integrated platform-plus-sensor terminal that combines Bluetooth, GPS, and an MPU6050 six-axis sensor to deliver seamless, full-coverage security. Key features include:

  • Real-Time 3D Posture Monitoring
    • The terminal’s built-in MPU6050 continuously records acceleration and angular-rate data.
    • Embedded algorithms convert these readings into a live 3D animation displayed in the mobile app.
    • When abnormal motions (e.g., forceful pulling or unauthorized opening) are detected, the system instantly triggers an alert.
  • Seamless Location Tracking
    • Under normal conditions, Bluetooth RSSI is used to maintain a stable link and estimate distance.
    • If the Bluetooth connection is lost, the STM32 controller activates the onboard A7 GPS module, uploads coordinates to the cloud, and the app fetches and displays the latest location on a map via the OneNet platform.
    • This dual-mode setup guarantees continuous visibility of the luggage’s whereabouts.
  • Customizable Anti-Loss Boundary
    • Users can define a safety radius in the app; the system continually converts Bluetooth RSSI into distance.
    • Once the luggage exceeds the preset boundary, the app immediately vibrates and issues an alarm, enabling rapid response to potential loss.

By fusing close-range Bluetooth alerts, remote GPS positioning, and 3D posture monitoring, Luggage Guardian offers seamless, reliable protection in any travel scenario, greatly enhancing travelers’ sense of security and peace of mind. The project was highly praised by BMW’s e-commerce manager, who expressed interest in collaboration.
